required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of LMA-Supreme and I-gel for the Incidence of Postoperative Sore Throat

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate and compare the incidence of the postoperative sore throat between LMA supreme and I-gel.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This study was closed earlier than planned because of lack of research staff.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after the end of surgery.
primary_outcome.description: The postoperative sore throat will be evaluated after the end of surgery by the investigator who are blinded to the group assignments. The investigator will ask the participant about his/her sore throat status.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The postoperative dysphagia will be evaluated after the end of surgery by the investigator who are blinded to the group assignments. The investigator will ask the participant about his/her status.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after the end of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The postoperative dysphonia will be evaluated after the end of surgery by the investigator who are blinded to the group assignments. The investigator will ask the participant about his/her status.

arm_group.description: Anesthesia is maintained using LMA supreme during surgery.
Anesthesia is maintained using I-gel during surgery.

intervention.description: Anesthesia is maintained using LMA supreme in LMA supreme group or using I-gel in I-gel group according to the randomly allocated groups.
Anesthesia is maintained using LMA supreme in LMA supreme group or using I-gel in I-gel group according to the randomly allocated groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients aged over 19 years who are scheduled for elective surgery under general anesthesia using the laryngeal mask airway
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anticipated difficult airway
- Expected duration of surgery more than 4 hours
- body mass index more than 35 kg/m2
- pregnancy
- Upper gastrointestinal surgery or open abdominal surgery.

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain MedicineSeverance Hospital, Yonsei University Health System
